creator: agnes_clarke@nl.compuware.com
text:
You can specify XSLT <xsl:param> parameters, but not parameters for the 
processor itself...

For example, I would like to use the special features of Saxon (such as tracing 
and so on) but I cannot set these features even though they are defined in TRAX.

Added to cvs head... so planned for 1.6
We can now specify a factory and configure it. Example:

<style ...>
  <factory name="org.apache.xalan.processor.TransformerFactoryImpl">
    <attribute name="http://xml.apache.org/xalan/features/optimize" 
value="true"/>
  </factory>
</style>
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
ddevienne@lgc.com
text:
Wasn't the feature specified as:

<style ...>
  <factory name="org.apache.xalan.processor.TransformerFactoryImpl">
    <feature name="optimize" value="true" />
  </factory>
</style>

more natural? I thought the previous patch did it that way? --DD

I'm keeping the name used by the transformerfactory in the jaxp api
See 
http://java.sun.com/xml/jaxp/dist/1.1/docs/api/javax/xml/transform/TransformerF
actory.html
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
